subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Nikolay Davydenko seemingly saved his best for last, beating No. 2-ranked Rafael Nadal in an hour and a half Sunday to become the first Russian to win this men’s singles tournament.
snippet: Nikolay Davydenko seemingly saved his best for last, beating No. 2-ranked Rafael Nadal in an hour and a half Sunday to become the first Russian to win this men’s singles tournament.
